result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jeffrey J. Lehman appeared by video.  Attorney John Paul Holevoet appeared by video for Jeffrey J. Lehman.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Trial date is currently set for November. Attorney Holevoet heard on status of case and is going to file a motion to reconsider. Case might resolve by plea deal. Attorney Riniker heard on analyst and doesn't think a trial will be needed to resolve this case. Motion hearing set.

records.addlTxt: of completion
Status conference on May 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jeffrey J. Lehman in court.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Jeffrey J. Lehman.  Attorney Anthony Pozorski in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal heard and defendant will accept offer from DA. Per agreement, defendant will plead to Ct 1. State will recommend 2 years probation. Conditions of probation is random drug testing, court costs, and counseling deemed appropriate by DOC. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads guilty to Ct 1. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. Defendant would like a short recess to have a discussion with attorney. Back on the record. Attorney McDougal heard and defendant is requesting a new attorney. Court heard. Attorney McDougal heard and says defendant is now requesting more time to discuss this case. Court sets a status date.
Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jeffrey J. Lehman appeared in court, Attorney Lisa A McDougal for Jeffrey J. Lehman appeared in court, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Adam Fecht sworn and testified. Exhibit #1-Report offered, received, and accepted. Cross. Comments heard. Court heard and finds probable cause to bind over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s).
Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
